title: China gives aid in goods to North Korea
description: On April 21, 2005, China announced that it sent North Korea 480 tons of grain, a harvester and a seeding machine. The shipment from a Jilin province in China's northeast also included 100,000 saplings, 80 tons of rice, and 400 tons of corn, according to the official Xinhua News Agency.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
China gives aid in goods to North Korea

# Description
On April 21, 2005, China announced that it sent North Korea 480 tons of grain, a harvester and a seeding machine. The shipment from a Jilin province in China's northeast also included 100,000 saplings, 80 tons of rice, and 400 tons of corn, according to the official Xinhua News Agency.
justification: Project involves humanitarian aid and agricultural support without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Grain, agricultural equipment, and saplings provided as aid to North Korea

title: Chinese Government donates 10,000 tons of diesel fuel in 2005
description: In October 2005, on the 60th anniversary of the Korean Worker's Party, the Chinese Government donated 10,000 tons of diesel fuel to North Korea. The diesel was delivered on October 10, 2005 and October 11, 2005 by the Nanjing Tanker Corporation (中国长航南京长江油运公司) on short notice from Sinochem Corporation to North Korea.  Two 5,000-ton oil tankers (Daqing 434 and 438)  were deployed to carry out this task. After inspection, the cargo quality of Daqing 434 and Daqing 438 was highly praised by the North Korean government. 10,000 tons of oil is equivalent to 73,000 barrels of oil. Therefore, to estimate the monetary value of this donation ($4,134,720), AidData takes the average price ($56.64) of a barrel of West Texas Intermediate (NYMEX) Crude Oil in 2005 and multiplies it by 73,000 barrels of oil.
staff_comments: The precise grant commitment date is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
Chinese Government donates 10,000 tons of diesel fuel in 2005

# Description
In October 2005, on the 60th anniversary of the Korean Worker's Party, the Chinese Government donated 10,000 tons of diesel fuel to North Korea. The diesel was delivered on October 10, 2005 and October 11, 2005 by the Nanjing Tanker Corporation (中国长航南京长江油运公司) on short notice from Sinochem Corporation to North Korea.  Two 5,000-ton oil tankers (Daqing 434 and 438)  were deployed to carry out this task. After inspection, the cargo quality of Daqing 434 and Daqing 438 was highly praised by the North Korean government. 10,000 tons of oil is equivalent to 73,000 barrels of oil. Therefore, to estimate the monetary value of this donation ($4,134,720), AidData takes the average price ($56.64) of a barrel of West Texas Intermediate (NYMEX) Crude Oil in 2005 and multiplies it by 73,000 barrels of oil.
justification: Donation of diesel fuel directly supports fossil fuel consumption
evidence: 10,000 tons of diesel fuel donated, fossil fuel focus

title: China Donates Medical Equipment for Avian Influenza Virus
description: In 2005, the Chinese government donated equipment and material to North Korea for the examination and prevention of bird flus. The equipment includes test kits. The project aims to prevent the spread of bird flu in the country, especially via its border and trading ports.
staff_comments: The transaction amount of the donation remains unclear. The donation was part of the response to the spread of influenza strain H5N1 globally. China has also provided technical, financial and material assistance for the prevention and control of bird flu in neighboring countries. China has trained some veterinary professional technicians for ASEAN countries, and provided technical, material and financial assistance to Vietnam, Thailand, North Korea, Mongolia, and Indonesia.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
China Donates Medical Equipment for Avian Influenza Virus

# Description
In 2005, the Chinese government donated equipment and material to North Korea for the examination and prevention of bird flus. The equipment includes test kits. The project aims to prevent the spread of bird flu in the country, especially via its border and trading ports.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare and disease prevention without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical equipment donation for avian influenza prevention, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Government donates CHF 16500 to IFRC for kitchen sets in North Korea
description: According to financial tracking service flow ID 29399, in 2005 China donated CHF16,500 to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies to be directed to North Korea for Emergency Shelter and NFI sector. The description says "kitchen sets", and the flow date is Jun 10, 2005.

title: Chinese Government donates 227,532 metric tons of wheat in 2005
description: According to Chinese Government reporting to the World Food Program’s International Food Aid Information System (INTERFAIS), the Chinese Government donated and delivered 227,532 metric tons of wheat and wheat flour (in 14 separate deliveries of 6470 tons, 4695 tons, 2487 tons, 6154 tons, 4251 tons, 8022 tons, 7065 tons, 15194 tons, 11615 tons, 8612 tons, 8036 tons, 9748 tons, 11803 tons, 123380 tons) to North Korea in 2005.  To estimate the monetary value of the wheat donation ($27,934,103.64), AidData takes the international price of a ton of wheat in January 2005 ($122.77) and multiplies it by 227,532 tons.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

According to Chinese Government reporting to the World Food Program’s International Food Aid Information System (INTERFAIS), the Chinese Government donated and delivered 227,532 metric tons of wheat and wheat flour (in 14 separate deliveries of 6470 tons, 4695 tons, 2487 tons, 6154 tons, 4251 tons, 8022 tons, 7065 tons, 15194 tons, 11615 tons, 8612 tons, 8036 tons, 9748 tons, 11803 tons, 123380 tons) to North Korea in 2005.  To estimate the monetary value of the wheat donation ($27,934,103.64), AidData takes the international price of a ton of wheat in January 2005 ($122.77) and multiplies it by 227,532 tons.
justification: Project is focused on food aid and security, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Wheat donation for food security, developmental aid purpose

title: Chinese Government donates 47,614 metric tons of rice in 2005
description: According to Chinese Government reporting to the World Food Program’s International Food Aid Information System (INTERFAIS), the Chinese Government donated and delivered 47,614 metric tons of rice (in 12 separate deliveries of 2448 tons, 7498 tons, 7482 tons, 180 tons, 4289 tons, 6548 tons, 5617 tons, 5077 tons, 2694 tons, 2701 tons, 2250 tons, and 830 tons) to North Korea in 2005.  To estimate the monetary value of the rice donation ($288.38), AidData takes the international price of a ton of rice in January 2005 ($13,730,925.32) and multiplies it by 47,614 tons.

title: Chinese Government donates 500,000 tons of crude oil in 2005
description: In 2005, the Chinese Government donated approximately 500,000 tons of crude oil to the North Korean Government. 500,000 tons of oil is equivalent to 3,665,000 barrels of oil. Therefore, to estimate the monetary value of this donation ($207,585,600), AidData has taken the average price ($56.64) of a barrel of West Texas Intermediate (NYMEX) crude oil in 2005 and multiplied it by 3,665,000 barrels of oil. This crude oil donation project was supported via recurring grants from China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) between 2000 and 2017.  Since 1991, China has been North Korea's largest crude oil provider, making up 80% of its supply. Crude oil is provided to North Korea through a pipeline (known as the Dandong-Sinuiju Pipeline or Friendship Oil Pipeline) from the Daqing Oil Field, 800 kilometers north of the China-North Korea border. The pipeline, which was completed in December 1975, runs for more than 30 km from storage facilities in the Chinese border city of Dandong to an oil depot in Sinuiju in North Korea. It supplies approximately 520,000 tons (3.64 million barrels) of heavy crude oil each year, according to its operator, China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC). Once across the border, the crude oil is processed at North Korea's sole working refinery, the Ponghwa Chemical Factory, a facility built with Chinese assistance during the 1970s. The refinery turns the oil into refined products for North Korea's government, military, transport, agricultural and fishing sectors.
staff_comments: 1. In 2012, a North Korean source disclosed that every year ‘the Ministry of Commerce of China and the North Korean government will discuss the catalogue of aid products, quantity, period, etc., but it is basically 100,000 tons of grain, 500,000 tons of oil, and materials needed by North Korea worth 20 million US dollars.’  This annual oil donation arrangement between the Chinese Government and the North Korean Government dates back to the 1970s. On October 17, 1970, the Chinese Government and the Government of North Korea signed an Agreement on Mutual Supply of Critical Materials 1971-1976. Under the terms of this agreement, the Chinese Government agreed to provide the North Korean Government with 500,000 tons of crude oil per year.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
Chinese Government donates 500,000 tons of crude oil in 2005

# Description
In 2005, the Chinese Government donated approximately 500,000 tons of crude oil to the North Korean Government. 500,000 tons of oil is equivalent to 3,665,000 barrels of oil. Therefore, to estimate the monetary value of this donation ($207,585,600), AidData has taken the average price ($56.64) of a barrel of West Texas Intermediate (NYMEX) crude oil in 2005 and multiplied it by 3,665,000 barrels of oil. This crude oil donation project was supported via recurring grants from China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) between 2000 and 2017.  Since 1991, China has been North Korea's largest crude oil provider, making up 80% of its supply. Crude oil is provided to North Korea through a pipeline (known as the Dandong-Sinuiju Pipeline or Friendship Oil Pipeline) from the Daqing Oil Field, 800 kilometers north of the China-North Korea border. The pipeline, which was completed in December 1975, runs for more than 30 km from storage facilities in the Chinese border city of Dandong to an oil depot in Sinuiju in North Korea. It supplies approximately 520,000 tons (3.64 million barrels) of heavy crude oil each year, according to its operator, China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC). Once across the border, the crude oil is processed at North Korea's sole working refinery, the Ponghwa Chemical Factory, a facility built with Chinese assistance during the 1970s. The refinery turns the oil into refined products for North Korea's government, military, transport, agricultural and fishing sectors.
justification: Project involves donation and transportation of crude oil, a fossil fuel, supporting North Korea's fossil fuel dependency
evidence: 500,000 tons of crude oil donation, transportation via pipeline, processing at oil refinery

title: Chinese Government provides grant for Presidential Palace Local Area Network (LAN) Project
description: In 2005, the “Chinese Government provided a grant to the Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo for the Presidential Palace Local Area Network (LAN) Project. The monetary value of this grant is unknown. The purpose of the project was to establish a Local Area Network (LAN) with the Presidential Palace.  A groundbreaking ceremony for this project was held on June 27, 2005. Then, on July 12, 2006, the project was officially completed and handed over to the Congolese authorities.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 建的总统府网络工程交 or 中国援刚总统府局域网工程举.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant for Presidential Palace Local Area Network (LAN) Project

# Description
In 2005, the “Chinese Government provided a grant to the Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo for the Presidential Palace Local Area Network (LAN) Project. The monetary value of this grant is unknown. The purpose of the project was to establish a Local Area Network (LAN) with the Presidential Palace.  A groundbreaking ceremony for this project was held on June 27, 2005. Then, on July 12, 2006, the project was officially completed and handed over to the Congolese authorities.
justification: Project focuses on establishing a local area network for government use, with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Local Area Network (LAN) project for Presidential Palace, no energy or environmental components mentioned
